CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert A. Kress, broker, Allison Park and Mrs. Thelma Grier, day worker, Beltzhoover, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 21, 1962, pg. 6 with question: Do you think the Government should investigate Big Steel's hiking the price of steel?" Mr. Robert A. Kress' answer reads: "Yes, I do.  The higher price probably will have an effect on everything.  And therefore the dollar would not be woth 25c.  Inflation has to be stopped and should have been stopped a long time ago.  For an older person on pension this means he would be receiving practically nothing."  Mrs. Thelma Grier's answer reads: "I think it should be because it needs to be investigated.  Steel prices are too high."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Robert A. Kress wearing polka dot necktie, holding pipe, posed in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Thelma Grier wearing hoop earrings and dark opened overcoat, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
